message: The main series that comes to mind is Prison Break. The first season was good, the second was okay, then it just went downhill quick.
Heroes.
Alias. My wife and I really enjoyed it the first couple of seasons before all of the rambaldi nonsense starting being the center of everything.
The drag that is "lost"
Flash forward...

Ditto on Heroes. If they ended it after the first season it would have stood on its own as a quite original series, instead of drowning in mediocrity. Another that should have ended sooner is Lost. Lost wasn't quite so bad but it could have ended 3+ seasons earlier. >.>
heroes... they should have went with different story arc each season, like 24
and csi, I missed Grissom
Veronica Mars: first season was amazing, second was good, third was meh

I know a lot of people will disagree pretty highly with me, but The Walking Dead. I thought it was fantastic through the first few episodes, but it started to drop off pretty quickly. By the "Vatos" episode, I didn't even really want to watch it anymore.
@rulix awwww I still like Damages
Damages. First season was amazing. Last one became dizzy fail.
@ericflo me too. and i hope the next season (if the show won't cancelled) will be at least as good as second one. :)
every episode of csi miami
csi vegas and new york are good, (vegas has been going downhill since grissom is gone)

House, the first season was great, but after that it has been same thing over and over.

The patient is going to die! OMG house is a dick! I think it's Wilson's Disease! It was cancer. <yawn>
yeah house has gotten down to a formula but i think sometimes they have some major gems.. the last episode was one i think
Friends after season 7 or 8? jumped the shark when they use the same joke, 'conversationalist wizard'

if you don't enjoy 'case of the week' shows, you won't enjoy house. I love these procedural shows. I can't stand lost, flash forward, prison break, etc... just can't invest on a show knowing that there's 50% chance I won't see a conclusion of a single story. not saying that they're bad, just not my cup of tea.
and agreed with @JohnFail on The Walking Dead, big mistake straying away from the comic book.
Heroes takes the cake here. ... And I couldn't disagree more, I don't think damages belongs in this conversation at all.
Big love is getting really hard to watch. Same with californication.
+1 to Heroes
@ebryn agree with you about Californication. This season hasn't kept my interest at all.
Lost and Alias for sure. Both had amazing first seasons then became progressively more of a mess as it went on
15 eps into season 3 of Castle, have a feeling they're heading to a baad direction
The first 2 seasons of Weeds and Breaking Bad were EPIC!! Absolutely amazing!  But after that they just weren't as heart-racing jaw-dropping awesome

Burn Notice, definitively. Some tricks and episode stories still got some fun, but the neverending background reminds me somehow of the prison break's unprobable Scilla thing. If not for the Jesse character, S4 was quite bad.
and +∞ on Heroes BTW
@romain Exactly, after season 1 of heroes the writer's strike fucked that show up permanently.  It's a tragedy.
Chuck...I still love the show but the quality isn't up to snuff lately
what would you change about chuck?
The comedy...it's just not as funny anymore. And now that chuck and sarah are together, the romantic tension is gone.
@unwrangle Different casts too.
Battlestar Galactica. The first three seasons were absolutely solid, but the fourth faltered right out of the gate - though it did have it's good moments.
Heroes
@djchall VM isn't quite fair since they kept trying to change it.  Season 2 seemed like a mess but if you watch it on DVD as a complete set it's actually not bad.  I actually liked Season 3.
